description: You can use AWS::Organizations::Account to manage accounts in organization.

AccountName.description: The friendly name of the member account.

Email.description: The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account.

RoleName.description: The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically preconfigures in the new member account. Default name is OrganizationAccountAccessRole if not specified.

ParentIds.description: List of parent nodes for the member account. Currently only one parent at a time is supported. Default is root.

Tags.description: A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account. For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.

AccountId.description: If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of the new account.

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.

JoinedMethod.description: The method by which the account joined the organization.

JoinedTimestamp.description: The date the account became a part of the organization.

Status.description: The status of the account in the organization.

Tag.description: A custom key-value pair associated with a resource within your organization.

Key.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

Value.description: The string value that's associated with the key of the tag. You can set the value of a tag to an empty string, but you can't set the value of a tag to null.
